NL System Query: Hi, can you teach me Quarto?
Pleas show me a win condition.
User Response: Assume you demonstrate this win condition

NL System Query: Is this a win because of the shape of the pieces?
User Response: Yes, that is why. They are the same.

NL System Query: What would happen to the win if I add a piece here?
User Response: It would stay a win. That is a valid move.
Comments: Add a piece where? Specify the rows/columns

NL System Query: Okay. Show me a new win condtion please.
User Response: Assume you demonstrate this win condition

NL System Query: Is this a win because of the shape of the pieces?
User Response: Yes, it is because they are all the same.

NL System Query: Would it stay a win if I remove the piece at (2,3)?
User Response: No, then it would no longer be a win condition.
Comments: The coordinates (2,3) don't seem very "natural" to me, that isn't how I would specify if I were playing this game

NL System Query: Please give an example of another winning board.

NL System Query: Looking at this previous board, would it be a win if I add a piece at position (1,1)?
User Response: Yes, that addition would be okay.
Comments: Once again, the tuple of coordinates doesn't feel very natural

NL System Query: Switching to this other board, is the pieces' height why it is a win?

NL System Query: On this board, how can I rotate these pieces.
